data.title: Excellent Bar Food--But Not Family-Friendly
data.text:
The food was to the standards described by other reviewers. Our midday experience in this bar was poor. We arrived with a 5-year-old who spilled her (rather large for a child) water, then our somewhat older father also spilled his. A headache for a busy waiter--to be sure. But our waiter was very huffy and ungracious in handling this typical restaurant bother. A good place for adults looking for a bustling sportsbar experience downtown. Not for kids or older folks.

We tipped the waiter well, but didn't feel welcome to return.

data.title: New place, Cool vibe
data.text: Nice little bar and grill.  Good beer selection.  Waiter recommended meatballs for appetizer and he did not steer us wrong!  Highly recommend them (home made) with the spicy burbon banquet sauce on them.

data.title: Great Bar!
data.text: Very friendly staff, great bar area, wonderful food choices on the menu, exciting downtown Cedar Rapids locations!

data.title: Another cold sports bar
data.text: Well what can I say, another way to do Buffalo Wild Wings.  They say they were shooting for Cheers.  Been to Cheers in Boston, very warm, wooden bar, personality, you remember. Pub 217 is metal, TV screens, dark, and a little Iowan warmth but not much.  My beer was good and the appetizer was tasty.  I was told that ma and pa Iowans were there in the corner as usual. Call me when real Iowan warmth shows up in this cookie cutter sports bar.

data.title: Fabulous
data.text: New favorite spot downtown. Haven't gotten anything that was bad there and I've made several trips. This is awesome, staff is friendly, prices of reasonable. Love love love

data.title: Adult hunor menu,  Great food
data.text:
Food was great.  Basically your bar type foods.  They also have weiners and spicy hot foods. Large variety of things.  
It is a smaller sit down area. It was packed because of a concert at the Paramount Theater so it was very loud. Hard to talk to someone sitting across the table.  The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5.
The service was good though. 
Keep in mind it is very busy before concerts downtown and parking can be hard to find during events.

data.title: Fantastic food, inviting atmosphere
data.text: Have been there many times since they opened.  We enjoy their food as well as the atmosphere.  It's a mom and pop atmosphere.  The owners are there every day and work very hard.  A great example of people trying to get ahead the right, by working hard.  Well worth a visit.

data.title: Awesome place to eat & socialize!
data.text:
After not being able to eat at another restaurant in downtown Cedar Rapids, I walked a mere 20 feet and stumbled upon THIS place: Pub 217. My kind of place! Their bar is in a "horseshoe" and they offer at least six big screen tvs. Their staff is well-versed in everything on their food and bar menu.When I was there, it wasn't quite to capacity but it was busy. I grabbed a seat at the bar and put in a food order for their signature sandwich, the "217 Burger". This is a quarter pound burger with hickory smoked bacon and all the usual toppings, cooked to order. It arrives with your choice of sides(I got their fries) and my usual ice tea. The server I had was an attractive young woman named Jess and she was attentive and helpful amongst the chaos. The place is well thought out to offer such an inviting place to eat and socialize, in my opinion.
Bathrooms are clean(at least the men's was) and this place caters to all walks of life.

data.title: Delicious Food and Great Service
data.text: We've eaten here 5 times (for supper and lunch on both weekends and weekdays) and each time the food has been delicious and the service has been top notch.  Each dish is freshly-made with good quantity and quality ingredients including house-made chips. It is now our go-to place for downtown meals.
